utterances.translation: Now, I will talk about how our language has changed.
Many women used to go to different places (when they got married).

transcript.default: histaqšiƛ ƛaʔuukʷiʔatḥ ʔucačiƛ qaay̓uuk̓ʷatḥ. histaqšiƛ ʕaaḥuusʔatḥ hinatšiƛ ʔaḥ c̓išaaʔatḥ.

transcription.default: histaqšiƛ ƛaʔuukʷiʔatḥ ʔucačiƛ qaay̓uuk̓ʷatḥ histaqšiƛ ʕaaḥuusʔatḥ hinatšiƛ ʔaḥ c̓išaaʔatḥ

utterances.translation: They came from Clayoquot to Kyuquot, or from Ahousaht to Tseshaht.
Their children listened to two people speaking in different dialects.
That is why our language changed.

transcript.default: waa, hiɬitƛa ʔaḥ ƛiisƛiisaquw̓as. ʔuušc̓iiy̓ap̓aƛ̓atukna ʔuuḥʷʼaɬ ciqy̓akukqin, maamaamaɬn̓iqsap̓atna.

transcription.default: waa hiɬitƛa ʔaḥ ƛiisƛiisaquw̓as ʔuušc̓iiy̓ap̓aƛ̓atukna ʔuuḥʷʼaɬ ciqy̓akukqin maamaamaɬn̓iqsap̓atna

utterances.translation: [When] we were at this school, we were forbidden to use our own language. They made us speak English.

transcript.default: hawiiʔaƛin ƛiisƛiisa niiw̓a waɬaak̓aƛna hiy̓atḥm̓inḥqin, t̓aatn̓ačiiɬšiƛ.

transcription.default: hawiiʔaƛin ƛiisƛiisa niiw̓a waɬaak̓aƛna hiy̓atḥm̓inḥqin t̓aatn̓ačiiɬšiƛ

utterances.translation: When we finish school, we came back home and had children.
We also made them speak English.

transcript.default: čuu ʔuy̓inƛniš ʔaḥʔaa hixʷaaʔaƛniš ƛaḥ kaƛḥakʔi, ʔun̓aaḥ qʷisḥʔaaḥin huʔacaʔap.

transcription.default: čuu ʔuy̓inƛniš ʔaḥʔaa hixʷaaʔaƛniš ƛaḥ kaƛḥakʔi ʔun̓aaḥ qʷisḥʔaaḥin huʔacaʔap

utterances.translation: Well, because of that we now have a hard time trying to find the way we can bring [our languages] back.

transcript.default: wik̓aƛ̓atna y̓uuqʷaa t̓aatn̓aakqin naʔaaʔat ʔunw̓iiƛḥin ʔuukʷiɬʔaƛ̓aɬ kaapapšiƛ maamaamaɬn̓iqa.

transcription.default: wik̓aƛ̓atna y̓uuqʷaa t̓aatn̓aakqin naʔaaʔat ʔunw̓iiƛḥin ʔuukʷiɬʔaƛ̓aɬ kaapapšiƛ maamaamaɬn̓iqa

utterances.translation: Also our children stopped understanding us [in our language] because people preferred talking in English.
It has become difficult to teach them.
They say it wrong now [they cannot pronounce words correctly].

transcript.default: ʔuy̓iiḥaʔaɬ ʔan wik̓aƛ̓atʔaɬ ḥaay̓aʕaaɬʔat hiniiy̓uɬ qʷayaatukqin niiw̓a.

transcription.default: ʔuy̓iiḥaʔaɬ ʔan wik̓aƛ̓atʔaɬ ḥaay̓aʕaaɬʔat hiniiy̓uɬ qʷayaatukqin niiw̓a

utterances.translation: This is because their throat is no longer used to the way we speak (the way our language sounds).
So, this is how we have lost our language.
